statement: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved Bristol Myers Squibb's Opdivo (nivolumab) plus Yervoy (ipilimumab) as a first-line treatment for adult and pediatric patients with unresectable advanced melanoma. The approval is based on the Phase 3 CheckMate-9DW trial, which showed a statistically significant overall survival benefit compared to investigator's choice of lenvatinib or sorafenib. The FDA also approved Opdivo as a treatment for resectable non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) in both a neoadjuvant-only and adjuvant setting. These approvals mark a significant milestone for Bristol Myers Squibb, giving it an edge in the treatment of NSCLC and advanced melanoma.
